Blocked weighted bootstrap - vectorised and parallel

Source: R/boot_bw.R
boot_bw.Rd

Blocked weighted bootstrap - vectorised and parallel

Usage

boot_bw_weight(w)

boot_bw_sample_cluster(p, w)

boot_bw_sample_clusters(x, w, index = FALSE)

boot_bw_sample_within_cluster(cluster_df)

boot_bw_sample_within_clusters(cluster_df)

boot_bw(
  x,
  w,
  statistic,
  params,
  outputColumns = params,
  replicates = 399,
  cores = parallelly::availableCores(omit = 1)
)

Arguments

w

A data frame with primary sampling unit (PSU) in column named psu and survey weight (i.e. PSU population) in column named pop

p

A random probability of selection

x

A data frame with primary sampling unit (PSU) in column named psu

index

Logical. Should index values be returned or a list of data.frames. Default to FALSE.

cluster_df

A data.frame() or a list of data.frame()s for selected clusters

statistic

A function operating on data in x (see example)

params

Parameters (named columns in x) passed to the function specified in statistic

outputColumns

Names of columns in output data frame

replicates

Number of bootstrap replicates

cores

The number of computer cores to use/number of child processes will be run simultaneously.

Value

A data.frame() with:

  • ncol = length(outputColumns)

  • nrow = replicates

  • names = outputColumns

Examples

boot_bw(
  x = indicatorsHH, w = villageData, statistic = bootClassic, 
  params = "anc1", replicates = 49
)
#>         anc1
#> 1  0.2383721
